epp:phrases.epp:phrase: The FTE of the staff member as a fraction between 0 and 1.
The researcher's unique Higher-Education Statistics Agency (HESA) identifier.
The staff category of the staff member
Please select your Unit of Assessment.
Please select your Unit of Assessment.
Select the Unit(s) of Assessment that this user will be responsible for.
Select the Unit(s) of Assessment that this user will be responsible for.
Indicate that the staff record contains sensitive information and should be excluded from publication.
A short statement evidencing the clear connection of the staff member with the submitting unit.
Select one or more instances for why a statement evidencing a substantive connection will not be required (not included in submission but may be required in the event of audit).
Please select up to 4 research groups.
Indicates the staff member should not be included in the submission.
Indicate whether this user is an Early Career Researcher.

Request to 'double weight' the output: for outputs of extended scale and scope, the submitting institution may request that the sub-panel weights the output as two. An additional output may be provided as 'reserve' for assessment if the panel does not agree with the double-weighting.
A statement justifying the proposal for double weighting.
Request for cross-referral: a request to the sub-panel to consider cross-referring the output to another sub-panel for advice.
Indicate whether the output is proposed to be cross referred to another panel.
A brief abstract, for outputs in languages other than English. Maximum 100 words.
Identify an output that will not be assessed if this output is accepted as double weighted.
A single letter or digit code for the research group associated with this output.
Tick this box if this item is the product of interdisciplinary reserach. You may be required to provide .
Include here any additional information about the output that you feel the panel members need to consider. You are strongly advised to check the relevant panel criteria.

Please choose one of the following options:
Unclassified: Quality that falls below the standard of national recognised work. Or work which does not meet the published definition of research for the purposes of this assessment.
One star (1*): Quality that is recognised nationally in terms of originality, significance and rigour.
Two star (2*): Quality that is recognised internationally in terms of originality, significance and rigour.
Three star (3*): Quality that is internationally excellent in terms of originality, significance and rigour but which falls short of the highest standards of excellence.
Four star (4*): Quality that is world-leading in terms of originality, significance and rigour.
Note that this field is not submitted to REF.

Please choose one of the following options:
Unclassified: Quality that falls below the standard of national recognised work. Or work which does not meet the published definition of research for the purposes of this assessment.
One star (1*): Quality that is recognised nationally in terms of originality, significance and rigour.
Two star (2*): Quality that is recognised internationally in terms of originality, significance and rigour.
Three star (3*): Quality that is internationally excellent in terms of originality, significance and rigour but which falls short of the highest standards of excellence.
Four star (4*): Quality that is world-leading in terms of originality, significance and rigour.
Note that this field is not submitted to REF.
Indicate whether the output has been published in a language other than English.
Indicate if the record contains sensitive information and should be excluded from publication.
Indicate whether the output is to be published in December 2020.
Indicate whether the output has been listed against another member of staff in the submission.
Indicate if the named panel members have conflicts of interest with the output.
List the name(s) of the panel member(s) which may have conflicts of interests for commercial reasons.
Indicate whether a physical copy of the output should be provided for this output.
The DOI (or other URL, if no DOI is available) for any supplementary information published alongside an output.
Indicate to the sub-panel if the output embodies research in forensic science.
Indicate to the sub-panel if the output embodies research in criminology.
Indicate whether the output is compliant with open access requirements, has an applicable exception, or is not compliant.
Required when requested in the panel criteria and working methods.
Second output allocation, required when requested in the panel criteria and working methods.
Specify the output subprofile category for UoAs 3 and 12.
Indicate whether the submission system needs to track the author contribution statements to aid institutions in developing their submissions.
Author contribution statement to aid institutions in developing their submissions.
Indicate that the output record should be excluded from submission. No records with this flag set should remain in the submission when submitting it to the REF 2021.
Indicates the additional information statement includes a statement about significant material in common with an output submitted to REF 2014.
Indicates the additional information statement includes information about the research process and/or content.
Does Include Factual Information About Significance
Indicates the additional information statement includes factual information about the significance of the research.
A value indicating whether this staff member is an additional attributed staff member for a double weighted output or an output submitted to main panel D.
Select a different REF Selection as a reserve for the pending publication.
Select a different REF Selection as a reserve for a double weighted selection.
Indicate whether this user is an Early Career Researcher.
Indicate whether the staff member is a Research Fellow (for HEFCW-funded institutions only).
The number of months within the assessment period that the staff member has been absent (up to 2 decimal places).
The number of qualifying periods of maternity, paternity or adoption leave.
The number of outputs the user wishes to reduce without penalty for the member of staff citing complex circumstances.
The type of circumstances cited for the staff member.
3- Qualifying period of maternity, paternity or adaption leave
4- Period of additional paternity or adoption leave under four months
6- Category C clinical, health or veterinary professional
The date the staff member first met the definition of an early career researcher.
The name of the organisation that the staff member is employed by. For category C staff only.
The job title for the staff member at the organisation the member is employed by. For category C staff only.
Text explaining their research responsibilities and how their reseearch is focused in the submitting unit. For category C staff only
The FTE of the contract as a fraction between 0 and 1.
A short statement evidencing the clear connection of the former staff contract with the submitting unit.
Select one or more instances for why a statement evidencing a substantive connection will not be required (not included in submission but may be required in the event of audit).
Please select up to 4 research groups.
Please enter a distinctive name for this benchmark.
Please enter the end date for this benchmark. After this date, it will not be possible to select new publications. Leave empty if you do not know the end date of this benchmark.
Select Units of Assessment(s) for this user.
Enter REF information for this user (to be submitted to REF).

epp:phrase.p: Use this option to create a new Benchmark. You may create an empty Benchmark (which will contain no selections upon creation) or make a copy from the current Benchmark (in which case the new Benchmark will be pre-populated).
After creating the Benchmark, you will have to select it as the current Benchmark to allow users to make selections against it.
No existing benchmarks found, perhaps you should create a new one.
Please wait while the selections are being copied to the new Benchmark. You will then be redirected to the metadata page.
Are you sure you want to remove this benchmark? All the selections made against it will also be removed.
Warning: disabling the REF Support plugin will remove ALL the selections and benchmarks that you have made so far. Are you sure you want to continue?

p.strong: No information can be displayed on this page because:

ul.li: There are no users in the Unit of Assessment you are a Unit of Assessment Champion of.
And you are not affiliated to any Units of Assessment.

epp:phrases.epp:phrase: The benchmark you are viewing is now finished.
You are not permitted to make selections.
There are no REF Benchmarks set up yet.
The benchmark you are selecting against is now finished.
You cannot select for REF if you are not affiliated to a Unit of Assessment.

epp:phrase.p: You cannot yet select publications for REF as no Benchmarks have been organised.

epp:phrases.epp:phrase: items co-authored from 2014 onwards (unless REF CC excluded)
items deposited from 2014 onwards (unless REF CC exluded)

epp:phrases.epp:phrase: Selecting for No users found in your UoA.
Only Categories A or C Staff can submit.
Manages the REF Part 4 Environment data
1. BIS Research Councils, The Royal Society, British Academy and The Royal Society of Edinburgh.
4. UK central government bodies, local authorities, health and hospital authorities
5. UK industry, commerce and public corporations
8. EU industry, commerce and public corporations
11. Non-EU industry, commerce and public corporations

epp:phrases.epp:phrase: No benchmark defined. Before you can use the REF Support plugin, you must first create a benchmark.

epp:phrase.p: REF Selections require a Unit of Assessment.
To make your own REF Selection, please select a Unit of Assessment.
To select for a Unit of Assessment on behalf of other users, you must be a Unit of Assessment Champion
Below are you research outputs selected for your Unit of Assessment during the current benchmark
To view more information about this Unit of Assessment you need to be assigned as a Unit of Assessment Champion.
You have not been assigned a REF Select role and are therefore unable to select research ouputs either for yourself, or on behalf of others in your Units of Assessment.
You have not been assigned a REF Select role and are therefore unable to select research ouputs for your Unit of Assessment.

epp:phrases.epp:phrase: Research Group Code must be a single alpha or numeric character
The Research Group must have a code
The Research Group must have a name
Length exceeded for Research Group name (max: 128 characters)
This Unit of Assessment already has a Research Group with this code
Manage Research Groups definitions for the REF2021 submission
A single alpha or numeric character used to represent the research group
The name of the research group (max 128 characters)
The Unit of Assessment to which the Research Group belongs
Are you sure you want to remove this research group?

epp:phrase.p: Are you sure you want to remove this contract?

epp:phrases.epp:phrase: Length exceeded for REF field (max: characters)
HESA Identifier must be 13 characters long
Staff Identifier required if there is no HESA staff identifier
All Research Groups values must be a single alpha-numeric character (see Research Group )
All Research Groups must have a corresponding Research Group record (no record for Research Group )
Up to 4 Research Groups are allowed
FTE should have no more than 2 decimal places
A staff member with an FTE value between 0.2 and 0.29 inclusive must provide either a substantive connection statement, or a reason for no substantive connection
Users with the flag set should not be included in the submission
Outputs submitted for a former staff member must include a Month
Invalid Year. Must be one of 2014, 2015, 2016, 2017, 2018, 2019 or 2020
An English language abstract should be provided for research outputs in a language other than English
An Output Allocation is required for research outputs attached to Unit of Assessment
A second Output Allocation is required for research outputs attached to Unit of Assessment
Research Outputs with the flag set should not be included in the submission
The field is only valid for UoAs 11 and 12 (research output attached to UoA )
Outputs submitted for a former staff member must include a month
An article number must be present if the first page is not provided
The first page must be provided if the article number is not provided.
This output references a reserve but it has not been flagged as a double-weighted output.
This output references itself as a reserved output.
Problems reported. See individual report for further details
Indicate whether the output has been delayed by the COVID-19 pandemic.

An optional statement (max. 100 words) to explain the form of the submitted output to the pabels. E.g. a description of the version being submitted, and any particular omissions due to the delay issues encountered.
Must be used to describe the version of electronic output being returned where not possible to submit the final version in electronic form. E.g. "Proof", "Author Accepted Manuscript".
Brief description of type, used for REF items "T - Other". This description is exported via the "Publisher" field in the Outputs report.
